title: Lane Locker
body:
Just a suggestion to avoid lobby trolls and instalockers, why doesn't the lobby recognize the few abbreviations players use to call their position to graphically represent their dibs on that position in normals ?

Some may contend that this is the reason Team Builder is available, however, most people elect to just type their desired lane in chat and hope that nobody bogarts their position in norms... not everyone wants to fill a position they don't like in norms. In ranked sure, but if I'm just wanting to jam a quick game inbetween study I don't want to call first and have some kid force me out of the lane I called and play something less fun than imagined for the next 30 minutes.

What if, say, there was a vague map of the rift somewhere on the screen similar to the team builder one, and upon typing in recognized abbreviations or acronyms; e.g:

* JG
* TOP
* ADC
* SUPP
* MID

The correlating lane is immediately highlighted and your name is assigned to it so that there is indisputable evidence that you indeed called that lane first ?

replies.body: Fact is if an asshole want's a role, he'll take it, like this patch, the chat is synced up, the amount of time's I've gotten top but had a GP just take top anyway is ridiculous.
